column4: ok, I'll do that now.....but another question: some people suggested that you need to get it to boot with resolution of 1024x600 by changing a Xorg.conf file.....but I can't find this anywhere (or the ETC folder for that matter)
haha, you've given me your time, I'm grateful for that Emanon
http://www.elonex.com/products/webbook_spec.shtm    <<<------------ Specs for the webbook
sure
sure
see if i can do something abotu it
bb
the file doesnt exist by default but if one exists, it will be obeyed

if you use this: http://idyllictux.wordpress.com/2010/04/26/lucidubuntu-10-04-high-resolution-plymouth-virtual-terminal-for-atinvidia-cards-with-proprietaryrestricted-driver/   until the embedded video, you can set the boot res
if one doesnt exist (default in Lucid) then udev will attempt to detect stuff, sometimes it works, sometimes not
you just need to edit /etc/X11/org.conf and find samples online. If you want to make a skeleton file, boot to root recovery mode and run: Xorg --configure
untill now I think it doesn't exist (searched the flash drive), but where do I put the file if I want it to be obeyed by default?
run: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf   you now have write access to the file.
there's an example over here, and I've got the Xorg.conf file from there   -------->>>> http://webbookblog.com/reinstalling-ubuntu-or-other-linux-on-the-webbook/
cool, copy it in and reboot, if its good, cool. You can tweak with more options to get (maybe) better performance
copy it to the root or  syslinux or......there's lots of folders :P
whatever gets you write access to the file

Um....I already have write access because I'm using the USB as a regular drive right now......after I copy Xorg.conf to it, I'll plug it into the webbook and begin installing.....but the thing is I don't know where exactly the Xorg.conf is supposed to go (trying to clear it up for you :D )
if you read the xorg.conf is very readbale
oh ok.....thanks! I don't see a ETC folder, so i'm assuming I can just make a new  etc/x11 then put the Xorg.conf in there?
the X11 (not x11) folder, already exists
